name: Rovim

specials.name: Protean Anatomy
specials.description: A rovim’s vital organs shift and change shape and position constantly. Immediately after the rovim takes acid, electricity, or sonic damage, it gains the listed amount of resistance to that damage type. This lasts for 1 hour or until the next time the protean takes damage to one of the other types (in which case its resistance changes to match that type), whichever comes first.

specials.name: Change Shape
specials.description: The rovim can take the appearance of any tiny creature. This doesn’t change its Speed or its attack and damage bonuses with its Strikes, but might change the damage type its Strikes deal.

specials.name: Rage
specials.description:
Requirement the rovim has eaten more than a piece of food for the day and is not raging or fatiqued.  Effect the Rovim taps into their inner chaos and begins raging. the Rovim gains 1 temporary Hit Points. This frenzy lasts for 1 minute, until there are no enemies or objects that the rovim can perceive, or until the rovim fall unconscious, whichever comes first. The rovim can’t voluntarily stop raging. 
While the rovim is raging:
The rovim deal 2 additional damage with it's unarmed attacks. This additional damage is halved if your weapon or unarmed attack is agile.
The rovim takes a –1 penalty to AC.
The rovim can’t use actions with the concentrate trait unless they also have the rage trait. The rovim can Seek while raging.
After the rovim stops raging, they lose any remaining temporary Hit Points from Rage, and they can’t Rage again for 1 minute.

description: A Rovim is a tiny multicolored furred protean orb with tiny pupils, a hidden mouth beneath the fur and two small feet. They come from the primal plane of chaos, they are known for being cute and adorable to many onlookers and travelers that find one or a group of them. They often beg for various scraps of food. Most Rovim can subsist on one piece of food such as a piece of an apple or a slice of bread.  Overfeeding a Rovim tends to cause it to go into a violent and disruptive craze that causes wanton destruction to its surroundings and others, thus named after Rovagug the rough beast.
